input_schema.name: recurrent
input_schema.tips_en: Eating, in a discrete period of time (e.g., within any 2-hour period), an amount of food that is definitely larger than most people would eat in a similar period of time under similar circumstances, and the sense of lack of control over eating during the episode (e.g., a feeling that one cannot stop eating or control what or how much one is eating)

input_schema.subheading: Binge-eating episodes associated with ≥3 of the following:

input_schema.name: large
input_schema.label_en: Eating large amounts of food when not feeling physically hungry

next_steps.advice_en: Treat diagnosed BED with appropriate psychosocial and pharmacologic interventions.

creator_info.about_en: Robert L. Spitzer, MD, served as professor of psychiatry at Columbia University for 49 years before retiring in 2010. He was influential in the advancement of The Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM). He is recognized in many fields in psychiatry from severe mental illness to comparative diagnostics, such as the United States–United Kingdom Diagnostic Project, in which he helped author a paper comparing schizophrenia definitions in the US and UK.
